question: In which nation the "Sierra Maestra Mountain Range" is located?
explanation: Sierra Maestra Mountain Range is located in Cuba. It represents the highest area of Cuba. These ranges are rich in minerals such as copper, manganese, chromium and iron. The highest point of this range is Pico Tuquino, which is 1974 metres above sea level. It houses Turquino National Park and the now extinct species of "ivory-billed woodpecker" was last seen in these ranges.
